frameDefinitions: An Agent causes a Firearm to discharge which induces the rapid motion of the Projectile.
An Agent causes Air to move in a direction, usually specifying either in or out of the body.
An Agent or a Cause mentally or physically expends energy rendering an Input, whether implicit or explicit, into a Output.
This frame concerns internally undifferentiated Substances.
The words in this frame describe an Experiencer's emotions with respect to some Content.
In this frame a Source_emitter discharges its Emission along a Path or to a Goal.  ' (1) The factory exudes toxic fumes from three large chimneys.'
frameExamples: The bank robber <t>shot</t> at the clerks with an AK-47.
Erosion is the <t>work</t> of wind and water on rock.
As their gut bacteria ferment cellulose , they generate methane <t>gas</t> , which escapes from the rear ends of the insects.
My <t>enjoyment</t> of the movie was considerably impaired by the seven-foot guy sitting in front of me.
(1) The factory <t>exudes</t> toxic fumes from three large chimneys.
listRoleDefinitions: The entity whose rapid, dangerous motion is caused by the Agent and/or Firearm.
The Agent is the person performing the intentional act causing the motion of the Projectile.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the shooting event takes place.
The location in which the shooting event takes place.
The <fen>Agent</fen>'s breathing causes the motion of the <fen>Air</fen>.  <fen>Agent</fen> is generally the External Argument.
<fen>Air</fen> is the substance that the <fen>Agent</fen> causes to move.
The time at which breathing occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the breathing occurs.
A sentient entity whose physical and mental faculties are directly expended on the <fen>Input</fen> to create the <fen>Output</fen>.
A non-sentient entity whose physical faculties are directly expended on the <fen>Input</fen> to create the <fen>Output</fen>.
The mental or physical faculties onto which the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> expends energy.
The end product, either a concept or physical object onto which the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> has exerted its mental or physical faculties from the rudimentary state of <fen>Input</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Output</fen> was committed into reality.
The place where the <fen>Output</fen> was birthed.
The undifferentiated entity which is presented as having a permanent existence.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the emotion or other internal state.

<fen>Content</fen> is what the <fen>Experiencer</fen>'s feelings or experiences are directed towards or based upon.  The <fen>Content</fen> differs from a stimulus because the <fen>Content</fen> is not construed as being direcly responsible for causing the emotion.

The Frame Element <fen>Expressor</fen> marks expressions that indicate a body part, gesture or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflect his or her emotional state.  They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the area about which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> has the particular experience.
The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that <fen>Experiencer</fen>s in a certain emotional state participate in.
The time at which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is in the specified emotional state.
The <fen>Source_emitter</fen> is the item  from which the <fen>Emission</fen> are discharged.
The <fen>Emission</fen>s are discharged out of the <fen>Source_emitter</fen> .
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when  the <fen>Source_emitter</fen> emits the <fen>Emission</fen>.
listRoleExamples: The robbers shot at the clerks <fex>as they ran out of the bank</fex>
The bankrobbers were crazy enough to shoot at the clerks with an AK-47 <fex>inside the bank</fex>
All I know is that he was still breathing <fex>at 2AM</fex>.
Lee breathed with difficulty <fex>on the track</fex>.
<fex><t>Liquid</t></fex> flowed over the rocks but it was not water.
The delight <fex>on her face</fex> was mixed with asonishment.
Mr. Whiskers was upset <fex>about his cat treats</fex>.
It felt pretty awkward to partake in such a nervous <fex>ceremony</fex>.
<fex>Last year</fex>, Bob was still interested in the young Republicans.
